title: Magawa the mine-detecting rat wins PDSA Gold Medal
description: Magawa the African giant pouched rat has won a PDSA Gold Medal for his work detecting landmines.

title: How worried should we be about deadly cyber-attacks?
description: Experts have been warning for years that it's not a matter of if, but when, hackers will kill somebody.

title: 'One day everyone will use China's digital currency'
description: China plans a digital version of its currency, which some say could become a big global payment system.

title: Covid-19 restrictions: 'South Asian weddings should have 400 guests - not 15'
description: British Asian weddings are traditionally lavish affairs that tend to have hundreds of guests.

title: Britpop: Photographer Kevin Cummins revisits the 90s
description: The music scene's heady days are chronicled in a new book by former NME photographer Kevin Cummins.

title: Breonna Taylor: Why it's hard to charge US police over shootings
description: There are reasons why it's rare that excessive use of police force leads to a trial. Here they are.

title: The German medical students who want to learn about abortion
description: Lack of training is restricting access to abortion in Germany, but students are trying to change that.

description: How closely have you been paying attention to what's been going on during the past seven days?

title: Coronavirus: Are the lockdown restrictions too strict?
description: Some people, including scientists, believe the hard lockdown measures can be confusing.

title: Michael Kiwanuka accepts Mercury Prize in TV studio
description: Instead of a ballroom full of excitable musicians, the Mercury Prize 2020 was handed out in the socially distanced One Show studio.

title: Mercury Prize-winner Michael Kiwanuka: 'I am not an imposter'
description: How the London singer-songwriter battled crippling self-doubt to make one of the year's best albums.

title: Pregnant woman rescues husband from shark attack in Florida
description: Margot Dukes-Eddy dived into the water to save her husband "without hesitation", police say.

title: Uni self-isolation: 'PPE to pee' and being stuck in bedroom
description: How students in Glasgow halls of residence are coping with self-isolation amid a coronavirus outbreak.

title: Tiny 'teapot' found in Derbyshire garage sells for £390k

title: US election 2020: Eric Trump shares false Biden-teleprompter rumour
description: The Democratic candidate is being wrongly accused of getting help to answer questions on TV.

title: President Trump booed at Supreme Court as he pays respects to Ruth Bader Ginsburg
description: The president is heckled while paying his respects to the late justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg.

title: Rishi Sunak unveils emergency jobs scheme
description: The government and firms will top up workers' wages, helping cover three quarters of their hours for next six months.

title: Facebook 'Supreme Court' to begin work before US Presidential vote
description: The company's oversight board - which can overrule Mark Zuckerberg - begins work in mid-October.

title: Sir Harold Evans: Crusading editor who exposed Thalidomide impact dies aged 92
description: The British-American journalist, publisher and author was best-known for his campaigns against injustice.

title: Sir David Attenborough joins Instagram to warn 'the world is in trouble'
description: The broadcaster gained more than 200,000 followers within an hour of posting his first video.

description: Did a joke about life drawing spark the Hollywood star's interest in Wrexham's football club?

title: 'I'm so sad but not surprised' - Hamilton, Rapinoe & James react to decision not to charge officers in Taylor case
description: Sport stars including LeBron James, Lewis Hamilton and Megan Rapinoe express their disappointment at a decision not to charge any officers with the killing of Breonna Taylor.

title: Coronavirus: Test turnaround times getting longer in England
description: Under a third of tests done in community testing centres in England are processed within 24 hours.

title: Former Australia batsman Dean Jones dies
description: Former Australia batsman Dean Jones dies in India, where he has been working as a television commentator, at the age of 59.

title: Alonso says his F1 return is down to love of the sport
description: Fernando Alonso says he decided to return to Formula 1 because he loves the sport.

title: Google removes Uluru virtual walk from Street View
description: Parks Australia had requested user-generated images from the sacred site be immediately removed.

title: Belarus: Video shows protester's 'taxi escape' from police
description: Demonstrations have continued in Belarus since the president declared victory in last month's election.

title: Hancock refuses to rule out Christmas student lockdown
description: Matt Hancock refuses to rule out stopping students returning home, to limit spread of coronavirus.

title: Alan Partridge statue appears in Norwich
description: The 11ft brass statue of the fictional broadcaster was created by two super fans and exclaims "Aha!"

title: Man dies from eating more than a bag of liquorice a day

title: Rwandan genocide orphan's 'miracle' WhatsApp reunion

title: China’s new richest person is a bottled water tycoon

title: Pilot whales Tasmania: Rescuing whales in Australia's worst stranding

title: Trump on Meghan Markle: 'I'm not a fan of hers'
